result.execSummary:
The defendant Amber M. Larsin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Amber M. Larsin is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Amber M. Larsin was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Polk County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: May petition the court for early discharge if Probation feels it is appropriate.

miscConds.notes: $290.60 fine/cost to be paid to COCC within 60 days or set up payment plan.  Failure to pay will be a judgment.
$250.00 DNA surcharge to the COCC within 60 days or set up payment plan.  Failure to pay will be a judgment.
Subject to work release.  No good time.

Not to possess or use drugs or drug paraphernalia.
May not possess or use firearms or body armor.

Must follow recommendations of Probation.  If AODA requested, must comply.
Must provide DNA sample.
Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored, no body armor, if not US citizen face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.
